pullRequest.body:
Add some lemmas about `AccPt`.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [aa5eee6a15](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14787/commits/aa5eee6a150ca7e3a5a336b5c1876eed07115405)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ AccPt.clusterPt`
`+ accPt_sup`
`+ frequently_nhds_iff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

It's a lot nicer to rewrite `AccPt.map` using `map_nhdsWithin_le_nhdsWithin_apply` as
```lean
lemma AccPt.map {Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace Y] {F : Filter Y} {x : Y}
    (h : AccPt x F) {f : Y â†’ X} (hf1 : Continuous f) (hf2 : Function.Injective f)
    : AccPt (f x) (map f F) := by
  have : (map f (ð“[â‰ ] x âŠ“ F)).NeBot := map_neBot (hf := h)
  rw [Filter.map_inf hf2] at this
  apply this.mono
  apply inf_le_inf_right
  convert map_nhdsWithin_le_nhdsWithin_apply hf1
  ext y
  simp [hf2.ne_iff]
```
but I'm not sure how to make that work with the import hierarchy.

EDIT: nvm, I found a simpler proof which also works in `Basic`

one more thing: I realize you put this `AccPt.map` lemma here because it can't go earlier, but it seems like not a very natural place. Do you think there's another place that might be more natural (and still works)?

> one more thing: I realize you put this `AccPt.map` lemma here because it can't go earlier, but it seems like not a very natural place. Do you think there's another place that might be more natural (and still works)?

Perhaps it could go in #14834 's `DerivedSet.lean`

Putting it in `DerivedSet.lean` sounds good. Given that, can you please:

1. remove `AccPt.map` from this PR and just leave it for that one (with the updated proof)
2. retitle this PR and update the PR description
3. ping me one final time when you're done and I'll merge it

> Putting it in `DerivedSet.lean` sounds good. Given that, can you please:
> 
>     1. remove `AccPt.map` from this PR and just leave it for that one (with the updated proof)
> 
>     2. retitle this PR and update the PR description
> 
>     3. ping me one final time when you're done and I'll merge it

Does this look good? @j-loreaux
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9993350134/job/27620500120)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9993350134/job/27620500952)
I'm out of time, but I think you're missing some familiarity with the library and filters.
getting close.

This is very confusing because you're using `x` as both an argument to the declaration and as a bound variable. However, I don't think we want this, because:
```lean
theorem frequently_nhds_iff (a : X) {p : X â†’ Prop} :
    (âˆƒá¶  x in ð“ a, p x) â†” âˆ€ U : Set X, IsOpen U â†’ a âˆˆ U â†’ âˆƒ x âˆˆ U, p x := by
  rw [(nhds_basis_opens a).frequently_iff]
  congr! 1 with U
  rw [and_comm, and_imp]
```
and really, after the first line, the rest is just fiddly details. In fact, if the right-hand side was written as `a âˆˆ U â†’ IsOpen U` instead, this proof would just be `simp_rw [(nhds_basis_opens a).frequently_iff, and_imp]`. So, really, what's going on is that you're just picking a particular basis for the `ð“ a` filter, in this case, the *open* neighborhoods of `a`.
I thought of this as a direct analogy to `eventually_nhds_iff`. Wouldn't that also be something similar, with `(nhds_basis_opens a).eventually_iff`?
fair enough.
This is exactly `Continuous.continuousAt`, as you can verify with the proof `hf1.continuousAt`.
Hadn't thought of this like that, thanks. I'll remove it

This is phrased a bit strangely (it should use `Tendsto`), but this is just:
```
  tendsto_nhdsWithin_of_tendsto_nhds_of_eventually_within _
    hf1.continuousWithinAt eventually_mem_nhdsWithin
```

to match the way things unfold better
```suggestion
    (âˆƒá¶  y in ð“ x, p y) â†” âˆ€ U : Set X, x âˆˆ U â†’ IsOpen U â†’ âˆƒ y âˆˆ U, p y :=
```

Also, while you're here, can you please fix the statement of `eventually_nhds_iff` with the bounded / free variables the same way I had you do with this one? It's nearly impossible to parse.

`gcongr` is a nice tactic. If you haven't seen it yet, you should definitely familiarize yourself. `simpa` is also nice.
```suggestion
  apply map_neBot (m := f) (hf := h) |>.mono
  rw [Filter.map_inf hf2]
  gcongr
  apply tendsto_nhdsWithin_of_tendsto_nhds_of_eventually_within _ hf1.continuousWithinAt
  simpa [hf2.eq_iff] using eventually_mem_nhdsWithin
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Basic): add some `AccPt` lemmas
